company.name: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation
company.business_description: Wyndham Worldwide is a hospitality company that franchises and manages hotels throughout the United States under twelve hotel brands. Through its subsidiaries, it operates approximately 7,000 hotels and provides information technology and security services to franchised and managed properties.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

complaint.factual_background: Wyndham Worldwide and its subsidiaries operated a hotel franchise network and failed to implement reasonable data security measures to protect consumer payment card information. Between April 2008 and January 2010, hackers successfully breached Wyndham's computer network on three separate occasions, compromising over 619,000 payment card accounts and exporting data to a domain registered in Russia. These breaches resulted in more than $10.6 million in fraud losses to consumers and businesses.

representations_made.description: Claimed to safeguard customers' personally identifiable information using industry standard practices
representations_made.quoted_text: We safeguard our Customers' personally identifiable information by using industry standard practices. Although "guaranteed security" does not exist either on or off the Internet, we make commercially reasonable efforts to make our collection of such Information consistent with all applicable laws and regulations.

representations_made.description: Claimed to use encryption and security measures to protect confidential information from loss, misuse, interception and hacking
representations_made.quoted_text: Currently, our Web sites utilize a variety of different security measures designed to protect personally identifiable information from unauthorized access by users both inside and outside of our company, including the use of 128-bit encryption based on a Class 3 Digital Certificate issued by Verisign Inc. This allows for utilization of Secure Sockets Layer, which is a method for encrypting data. This protects confidential information - such as credit card numbers, online forms, and financial data - from loss, misuse, interception and hacking.

representations_made.description: Claimed to take commercially reasonable efforts to create and maintain firewalls and safeguards
representations_made.quoted_text: We take commercially reasonable efforts to create and maintain "fire walls" and other appropriate safeguards to ensure that to the extent we control the Information, the Information is used only as authorized by us and consistent with this Policy, and that the Information is not improperly altered or destroyed.

counts.title: Deception - Data Security Misrepresentation
counts.representation: Defendants represented that they had implemented reasonable and appropriate measures to protect personal information against unauthorized access
counts.fact: Defendants did not implement reasonable and appropriate measures to protect personal information against unauthorized access. They failed to use firewalls, allowed storage of payment card data in clear text, permitted use of easily guessed passwords (such as 'micros' for both user ID and password), failed to patch known vulnerabilities, and failed to detect or prevent three separate breaches over two years
counts.conclusion: Therefore, Defendants' representations as set forth in Paragraph 44 of this Complaint are false or misleading and constitute deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: Unfairness - Failure to Implement Reasonable Security
counts.representation: Defendants failed to employ reasonable and appropriate measures to protect personal information against unauthorized access
counts.fact: Defendants' actions caused or are likely to cause substantial injury to consumers that consumers cannot reasonably avoid themselves and that is not outweighed by countervailing benefits to consumers or competition. The breaches resulted in over 619,000 compromised payment card accounts and more than $10.6 million in fraud losses
counts.conclusion: Therefore, Defendants' acts and practices as described in Paragraph 47 above constitute unfair acts or practices in violation of Section 5 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a) and 45(n).

definitions.Approved Standard: PCI DSS or, at the election of Hotels and Resorts, any standard of comparable scope and thoroughness approved by the Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission.
definitions.Breach: an intrusion into a Cardholder Data Environment within a network that, as to Hotels and Resorts, is not an untrusted network, where Hotels and Resorts has reason to suspect the unauthorized disclosure, theft, modification, or destruction of Cardholder Data.
definitions.Cardholder Data: the meaning PCI DSS Version 3.1, attached hereto as Appendix A, gives to the term "Cardholder Data," i.e., "cardholder data" shall be defined, at a minimum, as the full PAN. The PAN is the unique payment card number(typically for credit or debit cards) that identifies the issuer and the particular cardholder account. Cardholder data may also appear in the form of the full PAN plus any of the following: cardholder name, expiration date, and/or service code.
definitions.Cardholder Data Environment: the meaning PCI DSS Version 3.1, attached hereto as Appendix A, gives to the term "cardholder data environment," i.e., the people, processes, and technology that store, process, or transmit cardholder data or sensitive authentication data.
definitions.Defendants: (1) Hotels and Resorts; (2) Wyndham Hotel Management, Inc.; (3) Wyndham Hotel Group, LLC and its successors and assigns; and (4) Wyndham Worldwide Corporation and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Hotels and Resorts: Wyndham Hotels and Resorts, LLC, its subsidiaries and divisions, and its successors and assigns; provided, however, that in no event shall "Hotels and Resorts" include any of the Wyndham-branded Hotels. No entity shall be considered a subsidiary or a division for purposes of the definition of Hotels and Resorts in the event such entity is no longer a subsidiary or division of Hotels and Resorts.
definitions.PCI DSS: the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard, Requirements and Security Assessment Procedures, Version 3.1, attached hereto as Appendix A, or, in the event such standard no longer exists, any successor standard established or approved by the Payment Card Industry Security Standards Council, any successor entity to said Council, or all of the major payment card brands. In the event no such successor standard or successor entity exists, PCI DSS shall mean a standard of comparable scope and thoroughness approved by the Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission.
definitions.Practice: any act or omission implicating information security, including any conduct, implementation, control, configuration, procedure, process, or policy.
definitions.Treat as an untrusted network: to implement the security protections that PCI DSS Version 3.1, attached hereto as Appendix A, requires to be put in place with regard to an untrusted network.
definitions.Untrusted network: the meaning that Requirement 1.2 of PCI DSS Version 3.1, attached hereto as Appendix A, gives to the term "untrusted network," i.e., any network that is external to the networks belonging to the entity under review, and/or which is out of the entity's ability to control or manage.
definitions.Wyndham-branded Hotel: an independently-owned hotel that is operated in the United States pursuant to a management or franchise agreement with Hotels and Resorts or Wyndham Hotel Management, Inc. or any of their respective subsidiaries (a) under one of the following brand names or any successor brand name to one of the following brand names: Wyndham Hotels and Resorts, Wyndham Grand, and Wyndham Garden Hotels, or (b) under any other hotel brand name that is marketed by Hotels and Resorts to potential licensees of such brand name by means of a Franchise Disclosure Document or any other regulatory disclosure document generally required by the Federal Trade Commission to be delivered to a potential licensee in connection with the sale of a franchise.

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Hotels and Resorts must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program to protect cardholder data for twenty years.

requirements.description: Establish and maintain comprehensive information security program
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Hotels and Resorts shall, no later than the date of entry of this Order, establish and implement, and thereafter maintain, for twenty (20) years after entry of this Order, a comprehensive information security program that is reasonably designed to protect the security, confidentiality, and integrity of Cardholder Data that it collects or receives in the United States from or about consumers.

requirements.description: Designate employee(s) to coordinate information security program
requirements.quoted_text: the designation of an employee or employees to coordinate and be accountable for the information security program;

requirements.description: Identify and assess material internal and external risks to cardholder data
requirements.quoted_text: the identification of material internal and external risks to the security, confidentiality, and integrity of Cardholder Data that could result in the unauthorized disclosure, misuse, loss, alteration, destruction, or other compromise of such information, and assessment of the sufficiency of any safeguards in place to control these risks. At a minimum, this risk assessment should include consideration of risks in each area of relevant operation, including, but not limited to, (1) employee training and management, (2) information systems, including network and software design, information processing, storage, transmission, and disposal, (3) risks emanating from the Wyndham-branded Hotels, and (4 ) prevention, detection, and response to attacks, intrusions, or other systems failure;

requirements.description: Design, implement, and test reasonable safeguards to control identified risks
requirements.quoted_text: the design and implementation of reasonable safeguards to control the risks identified through risk assessment (including any risks emanating from the Wyndham-branded Hotels), and regular testing or monitoring of the effectiveness of the safeguards' key controls, systems, and procedures;

requirements.description: Select and retain qualified service providers and require contractual safeguards
requirements.quoted_text: the development and use of reasonable steps to select and retain service providers capable of appropriately safeguarding Cardholder Data they receive from Hotels and Resorts and requiring such service providers by contract to implement and maintain appropriate safeguards for such information;

requirements.description: Evaluate and adjust information security program based on testing results and material changes
requirements.quoted_text: the evaluation and adjustment of Hotels and Resorts' information security program described herein in light of the results of the testing and monitoring required by Part I.C or any other circumstances (including any material changes to Hotels and Resorts' operations or business arrangements) that Hotels and Resorts knows or has reason to know may have a material impact on the effectiveness of such information security program.

provisions.title: Cardholder Data Assessments
provisions.summary: Hotels and Resorts must obtain annual third-party assessments of compliance with PCI DSS and related standards for up to twenty years.

requirements.description: Obtain annual written assessment of compliance with Approved Standard by December 31
requirements.quoted_text: Annually obtain a written assessment of the extent of Hotels and Resorts' compliance with the Approved Standard (each such annual assessment, together with any certification relative to such assessment that may be obtained pursuant to Part ll.B, being defined as an "Assessment"). Each annual Assessment shall be completed by December 31.

requirements.description: Assessor must certify extent of compliance with Approved Standard
requirements.quoted_text: For each annual Assessment, the assessor conducting the Assessment must certify as to the extent ofHotels and Resorts' compliance with the Approved Standard.

requirements.description: Assessor must certify individually whether each Wyndham-branded Hotel's network is treated as untrusted or is validated as compliant
requirements.quoted_text: certify individually, as to each Wyndham-branded Hotel, whether Hotels and Resorts treats as an untrusted network any Wyndham-branded Hotel's network that has a Cardholder Data Environment, and if any such network is not treated as untrusted, certify that such network either is included in the Assessment or has during the 12 months preceding the Assessment separately been validated to be fully compliant with the Approved Standard;

requirements.description: Assessor must certify extent of compliance with risk management protocol
requirements.quoted_text: certify as to the extent of Hotels and Resorts' compliance with each element of a risk management protocol at least as thorough as Version 2.0 of the PCI DSS Risk Assessment Guidelines, attached hereto as Appendix B;

requirements.description: Assessor must certify that assessment was conducted by qualified, objective, independent third-party professional
requirements.quoted_text: certify that the Assessment was conducted by a qualified, objective, independent third-party professional, who uses procedures and standards generally accepted in the profession, adheres to professional and business ethics, performs all duties objectively, and is free from any conflicts of interest that might compromise the assessor's independent judgment in performing Assessments. Professionals qualified to prepare Assessments shall be: a person qualified as a Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) or as a Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA); a person holding Global Information Assurance Certification (GIAC) from the SysAdmin, Audit, Network, Security (SANS) Institute; a Qualified Security Assessor under PCI DSS (QSA); or, at the election of Hotels and Resorts, a similarly qualified person or organization approved by the Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission.

requirements.description: If assessment is noncompliant, obtain certification of extent of compliance with unfulfilled requirements within 60 days
requirements.quoted_text: If the assessor that conducts an Assessment descnbed in Part ll.A does not certify that Hotels and Resorts is fully compliant with the ApprovedStandard on which the Assessment in question is based and with the risk protocol referenced in Part ll.A.2 (a "Noncompliant Assessment"), Hotels and Resorts shall, within sixty (60) days from the completion of the Noncompliant Assessment in question, obtain a certification from an assessor qualified under Part ll.A.3 attesting as to the extent of Hotels and Resorts' compliance with any requirements under the Approved Standard and/or the risk protocol in question that were not certified as being in place by the assessor that conducted the Assessment.

requirements.description: Obtain PCI forensic investigator report within 180 days of breach involving more than 10,000 payment card numbers
requirements.quoted_text: Within one hundred and eighty (180) days following discovery of a Breach involving more than 10,000 unique payment card numbers, Hotels and Resorts shall obtain an assessment that meets the requirements, established by the PCI Security Standards Council, of a PCI Forensic Investigator Final Incident Report (or the equivalent of such a report under then-current standards established by the PCI Security Standards Council, any successor entity to said council, or the major card brands), or, at the election of Hotels and Resorts, a standard of comparable scope and thoroughness approved by the Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission.

requirements.description: Provide each assessment, certification, and report to FTC within 10 days of receipt
requirements.quoted_text: Hotels and Resorts shall provide each Assessment required by this Part II, including any Part II.B certification or Part II.C report, to the Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, within ten (10) days after the Assessment, certification, or report is delivered to Hotels and Resorts by the assessor or investigator in question.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgements
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit acknowledgements of receipt of this Order and deliver copies to subsidiaries, personnel, and other specified parties.

requirements.description: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation, Wyndham Hotel Group, LLC, and Hotels and Resorts must submit acknowledgement of receipt to Commission
requirements.quoted_text: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation, Wyndham Hotel Group, LLC, and Hotels and Resorts, within seven (7) days of entry of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgement of receipt of this Order.

requirements.description: Hotels and Resorts must deliver copy of Order to all current subsidiaries
requirements.quoted_text: Hotels and Resorts shall deliver a copy of this Order: (1) to all its current subsidiaries within thirty (30) days after entry of this Order;

requirements.description: Hotels and Resorts must deliver copy of Order to future subsidiaries within 30 days of acquisition for 10 years
requirements.quoted_text: for ten (10) years after entry of this Order, to any future subsidiary within thirty (30) days after its acquisition by Hotels and Resorts.

requirements.description: Defendants must deliver copy of Order to current principals, board members, managers, officers, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities within 14 days
requirements.quoted_text: For ten (10) years after entry of this Order, Wyndham Worldwide Corporation, Wyndham Hotel Group, LLC, and Hotels and Resorts must deliver a copy of this Order to (1) all controlling principals, board of directors members, and LLC managers and members; (2) all officers, employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Part titled Compliance Reporting. Delivery must occur within fourteen (14) days of entry of this Order for current personnel.

requirements.description: Defendants must deliver copy of Order to future personnel before they assume responsibilities for 10 years
requirements.quoted_text: For all other personnel, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit compliance reports to the Commission and notify the Commission of changes in structure or designated points of contact.

requirements.description: Submit initial compliance report one year after entry of Order
requirements.quoted_text: One year after entry of this Order, Wyndham Worldwide Corporation, Wyndham Hotel Group, LLC, and Hotels and Resorts each must submit a compliance report certified as truthful by a senior corporate officer with the requisite corporate and organizational authority that (a) identifies the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission may use to communicate with that Defendant; (b) identifies all of that Defendant's United States businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describes the activities of that Defendant's business and the involvement of any other Defendant; (d) describes in detail (either directly or by incorporating by reference a Part ll.A. Assessment) whether and how that Defendant is in compliance with each Part of this Order; and (e) provides a copy of each Order Acknowledgement obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit compliance notice within 14 days of change in designated point of contact or corporate structure for 10 years
requirements.quoted_text: For ten (I 0) years after entry of this Order, each of Wyndham Worldwide Corporation, Wyndham Hotel Group, LLC, and Hotels and Resorts must submit a compliance notice within fourteen (14) days of any change in the following: (a) any designated point of contact; or (b) the structure of that Defendant or any entity that that Defendant bas any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, assignment, sale, merger, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any act or practice subject to this Order.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendants must maintain and make available to the Commission all materials relied upon to prepare assessments for three years after preparation.

requirements.description: Maintain all materials relied upon to prepare assessments for three years and make available to Commission upon request
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Wyndham Worldwide Corporation, Wyndham Hotel Group, LLC, and Hotels and Resorts shall maintain and upon request make available to the Commission for inspection and copying, a print or electronic copy of: For a period of three (3) years after the date of preparation of each Assessment required under Part n of this Order, all materials relied upon to prepare the Assessment, whether prepared by or on behalf of Hotels and Resorts, including but not limited to all plans, reports, studies, reviews, audits, audit trails, policies, training materials, and assessments, and any other materials relied upon to prepare the Assessment.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Defendants' compliance through discovery and compulsory process.

requirements.description: Commission is authorized to seek discovery without further leave of Court
requirements.quoted_text: The Commission is authorized to seek discovery, without further leave of Court, using any of the procedures prescribed by Federal Rules of Civil Procedure 29, 30 (including telephonic depositions), 31, 33, 34, 36, 45, and 69. Defendants may assert any and all objections, defenses, rights, or privileges in the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, the Federal Rules of Evidence, or any other applicable law, as to any such discovery request.

requirements.description: Commission may use compulsory process pursuant to FTC Act Sections 9 and 20
requirements.quoted_text: Nothing in this Order limits the Commission's lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-l. Defendants may assert any and all objections, defenses, rights, or privileges available to them, as to any such process.

provisions.title: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation and Wyndham Hotel Group, LLC Oversight
provisions.summary: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation and Wyndham Hotel Group, LLC must ensure Hotels and Resorts complies with the Order while they hold it as a subsidiary, for up to 20 years.

requirements.description: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation and Wyndham Hotel Group, LLC must ensure Hotels and Resorts complies with Order while held as subsidiary, up to 20 years
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, so long as Wyndham Worldwide Corporation or Wyndham Hotel Group, LLC directly or indirectly holds Hotels and Resorts as a subsidiary, but in any event no longer than 20 years after entry of this Order, it shall ensure that Hotels and Resorts complies with this Order.

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of modification and enforcement of the Order.

requirements.description: Court retains jurisdiction for modification and enforcement
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS Fl.JRTHER ORDERED that this Court shall and does retain jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of, and shall have exclusive jurisdiction over, any matter or proceeding involving or relating to the modification and/or enforcement of this Order.

duration.termination_text: IT IS ORDERED that Hotels and Resorts shall, no later than the date of entry of this Order, establish and implement, and thereafter maintain, for twenty (20) years after entry of this Order, a comprehensive information security program
